info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 2:46PM EST until January 09 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Alexander County in the piedmont of North Carolina... Catawba County in the piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 700 PM EST. * At 246 PM EST, local first responders reported several roads closed or made impassable due to heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen since last night. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are possible before precipitation ends late this afternoon. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * In Alexander County, Heavenly Acres Ln is covered by water and has cut off some residents. Paul Payne Rd and Macedonia Church Rd are becoming impassable and may soon require closure. In Catawba County, McLin Creek has risen out of its banks near Claremont and has threatened homes on Kay St and near Shangri-La Drive. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Heavy rain is increasing the risk of landslides, especially in areas where slides have occurred in the past. Be especially alert if you are near a stream, especially at the base of a mountain or in a cove. Watch for loose-moving soil and rocks or a sudden increase in streamflow. Leave the area quickly if this is observed. When driving along roads where the terrain is steep or rocky, watch and listen for falling rocks, mud, trees and other debris. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
